text: That said - I've seen similar levels of over engineering in industry. People using like 20 layer neural nets that explode in production, when twists on linear regression with some domain specific preprocessing were more robust, offered immediately better performance, and as you can imagine required way less data and trained much faster...

elements.text: That said - I've seen similar levels of over engineering in industry. People using like 20 layer neural nets that explode in production, when twists on linear regression with some domain specific preprocessing were more robust, offered immediately better performance, and as you can imagine required way less data and trained much faster...

text: I would have done that, but I decided not to continue running a small instance 24/7 in GCP. It would have cost around one Netflix monthly sub.

elements.text: I would have done that, but I decided not to continue running a small instance 24/7 in GCP. It would have cost around one Netflix monthly sub.

text: do you actually understand Kubernetes? If so I have questions. I've searched the internet far and wide to talk to a human about k8s(or k3s) and so far no one I've found actually claims to know how to use it :joy:

elements.text: do you actually understand Kubernetes? If so I have questions. I've searched the internet far and wide to talk to a human about k8s(or k3s) and so far no one I've found actually claims to know how to use it

text: I know some things. The hardest parts seemed to be the networking.

elements.text: I know some things. The hardest parts seemed to be the networking.

text: I was first trying to build Kubernetes files by hand, but I think that’s backwards.

elements.text: I was first trying to build Kubernetes files by hand, but I think that’s backwards.

text: You can create the environment you want in GCP, and export it to Kubernetes files, which I think is easier.

elements.text: You can create the environment you want in GCP, and export it to Kubernetes files, which I think is easier.

text: And as GCP split your usage of it in separate billable processes, you won’t get any other stuff exported.

elements.text: And as GCP split your usage of it in separate billable processes, you won’t get any other stuff exported.

text: I also tried to use Helm, but it adds complexity, and Go’s templating mechanism.

elements.text: I also tried to use Helm, but it adds complexity, and Go’s templating mechanism.

text: Then I found that it’s easier to use “gcloud compute instances create-with-container” as I wanted only one docker container running there.

elements.text: Then I found that it’s easier to use “gcloud compute instances create-with-container” as I wanted only one docker container running there.
